greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of connected integer partitions of n whose distinct parts are pairwise indivisible.
comment: Given an integer partition y of length k, let G(y) be the simple labeled graph with vertices {1..k} and edges between any two vertices i, j such that GCD(y_i, y_j) > 1. For example, G(6,14,15,35) is a 4-cycle. A partition y is said to be connected if G(y) is a connected graph.
xref: The Heinz numbers of these partitions are given by A329559.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Nov 18 2019
